page.title: 15Industry in Trafford Park 2
page.content: There are a few large industrial plants at the eastern end of Trafford Park such as Esso Oil and Petrol Regional Centre, Procter and Gamble which make soap powders etc, General Electric Company who are electrical engineers and C.P.C. who refine cornflour for use in custard powder etc. You can smell their works for miles when the wind blows from the south! Many buildings are at least twenty years old but here and there, buildings have been demolished and small, single storey factories have been built for light, metal-working industries eg. 797 971. A brand new road system has been built called Park Way, which is much wider than the old roads used to be and a small trading estate of warehouses has been established. The new Daily Telegraph printing works is almost finished.
